meanings.definition: A former Portuguese and Spanish coin.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used an escudo to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found an old escudo in my grandfather's collection of coins.
meanings.sent3: The escudo rolled off the table and into the piggy bank, trying to save itself.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny escudo, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the escudo hitting the ground echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: A shield or emblem bearing a coat of arms.
meanings.sent1: The knight carried his escudo proudly into battle.
meanings.sent2: The family crest was displayed on the escudo above the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The escudo tried to hide behind the curtain, pretending to be a ninja.
meanings.sent4: Her words were her escudo, protecting her from the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering escudo caught the sunlight, dazzling all who saw it.
